elements.content: A cadmium(II)-based metal–organic framework for selective trace detection of nitroaniline isomers and photocatalytic degradation of methylene blue in neutral aqueous solution†II Pengyan Wu Yanhong Liu Yang Li Min Jiang Xiu-ling Li Yanhui Shi and Jian Wang 1,23456,78–101112–1415(a) Coordinated environment of the Cd2+ ions in Cd–PDA. Symmetry code: A, x, 1 + y, z; B: 1.5 − x, 0.5 + y, 0.5 − z. (b) One-dimensional double chain structures formed by Cd2(CO2)4 motifs and PDA2− linkers along the [010] direction. (c) View of Cd–PDA crystal packing along the b direction showing the rectangular channels. The hydrogen atoms were omitted for clarity.

elements.content: Fig. 4 (a) Recyclability test on Cd–PDA sensing of p-NA. Fluorescence was recovered by simply filtering and washing with fresh ethanol. Red bar: emission of the sample before sensing of p-NA. Green bar: emission of the sample after sensing of p-NA. (b) Powder X-ray diffraction profiles for the simulated (black), as-synthesized (red) and Cd–PDA samples after the five cycles (blue).
elements.clean_text: Fig. 4  (a) Recyclability test on Cd-PDA sensing of p-NA. Fluorescence was recovered by simply filtering and washing with fresh ethanol. Red bar: emission of the sample before sensing of p-NA. Green bar: emission of the sample after sensing of p-NA. (b) Powder X-ray diffraction profiles for the simulated (black), as-synthesized (red) and Cd-PDA samples after the five cycles (blue).

elements.content: 23(a) K–M functions versus energy [eV] for Cd–PDA, where Kubelka–Munk (K–M) function: α/S = (1 − R)2/2R; α is the absorption, S is the scattering coefficient, and R is the reflectance at a given energy. (b) Absorption spectra of the MB solutions during the decomposition reaction catalyzed by complex Cd–PDA; the inset picture shows the molecular structure of MB. (c) Photocatalytic decomposition of MB solutions under 500 W xenon lamp irradiation of Cd–PDA; (C and C0 stand for the MB concentrations after and before irradiation), the inset showing the photographs of MB solutions in 0 h (I), 0.5 h (II), 1.5 h (III) and 2 h (IV), respectively. (d) Powder XRD patterns of the as-synthesized Cd–PDA (black line), Cd–PDA after exposure in water for 2 days (red line) and after 5 photocatalytic cycles (blue line).
elements.clean_text:
23

(a) K-M functions versus energy [eV] for Cd-PDA, where Kubelka-Munk (K-M) function: α/S = (1 - R)2/2R; α is the absorption, S is the scattering coefficient, and R is the reflectance at a given energy. (b) Absorption spectra of the MB solutions during the decomposition reaction catalyzed by complex Cd-PDA; the inset picture shows the molecular structure of MB. (c) Photocatalytic decomposition of MB solutions under 500 W xenon lamp irradiation of Cd-PDA; (C and C0 stand for the MB concentrations after and before irradiation), the inset showing the photographs of MB solutions in 0 h (I), 0.5 h (II), 1.5 h (III) and 2 h (IV), respectively. (d) Powder XRD patterns of the as-synthesized Cd-PDA (black line), Cd-PDA after exposure in water for 2 days (red line) and after 5 photocatalytic cycles (blue line).

metadata.title: A cadmium( ii )-based metal–organic framework for selective trace detection of nitroaniline isomers and photocatalytic degradation of methylene blue in neutral aqueous solution
